Description: Body sherd of Attic black-figured pottery band-cup; interior: glazed black; exterior: black-figure decoration consisting of part of siren (part of wing with added red and part of tail remaining) to right.
Curator's comments: For parallels regarding the siren, compare Vierneisel, K. and Kaeser, B., Kunst der Schale. Kultur des Trinkens. Munich 1990, 31, fig. 2.14, 159, fig. 25.7a (Munich 2229).
Bibliographic references: Venit 1982 / Painted Pottery from the Greek Mainland found in Egypt, 640-450 BC (p. 441, no. B722)
Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GA.0475) (Phase 1)
